website_summaries.verdict: The Baltic birch gives it a nice look, while the adjustable playing surface lets you change the pitch of the backbeat.
pros: Constructed in Europe from Baltic birch
Compact with a rear port for easy mic placement
cons: Internal snare wires are fixed, not adjustable
Some buyers find it to be smaller than expected

customer_reviews.title: Perfect compact cajon
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It has a crisp sound and is perfect for a studio apartment. I can tap out personal rhythms or really slap it and let the neighbors hear. Excellent craftsmanship and solid construction. I'm about 5'10" 190 and have no problem sitting and playing comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great little instrument- love the sound and so much fun to play
customer_reviews.text: We love this compact cajon!! The price was right, and it is so much fun to play. You can hit it anywhere and get so many different sounds. We have many percussion instruments in the house, but this one already is the most played. Someone with no experience can sit down and tap out some beats on this. If you have kids who are tappers (you now the ones.. constantly drumming on something), get them this!
customer_reviews.author: T. Zelinka

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drum box!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my brother. He no longer plays drums, but he's always banging on things as if they were. I opened it before I gave it to him to inspect for damage and just had to try it. It sounds great and seems of good quality. I've played with a lot of drummers over the years and would recommend this to your favorite drummer or the person who loves playing behind the dining room table kit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike N.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-size for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a great "intermediate size" cajon. We have a full size adult one and our kids like playing it but its just a little too big to be something they can really learn on. So we got this one and it's been great. Pictures is of our (tall for his age) 6 year old. This cajon has a good sound and we've had no problems with it so far. Good quality and came in good condition. We have been satisfied with meinl products overall so far and this one didn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: MarsDinosaur

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound for a small group of musicians
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a drum kit, but I do have an electronic kit made by Roland. It's not going anywhere, and I don't have money to buy a kit to take on the road for gigs that my very small group of older guys might snag. We don't have a bass player and so need someone to lay down and keep a beat with a nice sound, and this Cajon box drum works wonderfully for that purpose. It's completely portable, it makes good music and it's something I can play with just a little training thanks to YouTube videos.
customer_reviews.author: Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Sounds Great, Long Lasting, What's to Not Like...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using one of these for many years, and when it finally began leaking the beads, I bought another. It's perfect for keeping a groove, especially when you don't need a very loud sound. It is very comfortable and lightweight to use, and unlike the other brand with the rubber bands holding the two parts together, I never have to worry about it twisting or coming apart! I don't have any use for splitting it up and using it as two separate pieces, if I wanted a pair of maracas, I'd buy them, but this is a shaker, and nice one...
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Charles

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Shaker.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried most every shaker on the market. IMO, these are the best. It's my go-to shaker. The difference is the way they feel in the hand, the quality texture of sound and projection onstage. The vertical grip provides an easier ability to add little rolls and colors in between the cadence. They just feel right and are manipuated so much easier than traditional maraca's. I have the studio and live version. Each has it's own texture and volume according to the setting. I have used both live on stage in a variety of venues and they always cut through the mix.
customer_reviews.author: Log

customer_reviews.title: Solid especially for the money MODEL JC50LBNT
customer_reviews.text: I saw and heard this one used in a coffee shop setting and, as one of my kids finally showed interested, we took the chance and purchased our own. It is small in size but gives off a decent sound and seems very stable in it's quality. I can't stand when you purchase a 'beginner' instrument and it won't hold tune for more than a moment and this Meinl product does not give that feel at all. Nice looking, solid, portable and affordable; an excellent combination to make this a preferred purchase. Well done!
customer_reviews.author: D. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Great  Meinl Cajon Box Drum - great for beginners, love the sound, quality is well built.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the drums, and is always looking into playing something with this hands. Son this product on a youtube video and had to get it for my son. This Meinl Cajon box wasnt the cheapest, yet wasnt the most expensive, but was just right for a beginner's instrument. Sounds are rich and deep in bass; I thought at first the quality would'nt stand up but my son has been beating away for almost two weeks not and its supurb. Recommend to anyone starting to learn how to play a cajon box drum.
customer_reviews.author: Ask Steven

customer_reviews.title: Good First Hand Drum
customer_reviews.text: This cajon has both good bass & snare sounds. It is comfortable for me to sit on it & play. However, I am 5'4" & small petite woman. If I were much taller, then I might find myself hunched over while playing & not so comfortable. I really like how easy it is to play this drum. I play along with music & hope to be able to accompany some casual bands. There is also something very soothing to playing the drum & it makes me feel good. I highly recommend this particular cajon & drum playing in general.
customer_reviews.author: mm

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my almost 10 year old because she had expressed interest in playing the drums. So to start, I bought her this cajon and a foot tambourine. She's picked it up pretty quick! The cajon seems well made and sounds really good. I don't have anything to compare it to, but all in all I like it a lot. Great instrument to start with, before graduating to a drum kit. And it's perfect for acoustic jam sessions.
customer_reviews.author: JM76

customer_reviews.title: A New Perspective
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cajon, to build up a new skill in percussion instruments with all the quarantine. I really was excited to see it come in. The sound quality is really good for the actual price of the instrument. The color of the box is amazing and also the weight is light. so it makes it easy to move around the house. The one upset to the cajon is the size, I was not aware of the size until It came in the mail. Even using the amazon "View in room option" I really could not tell how tall the Cajon was. I wished it showed the height before I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: David Ogbonna

customer_reviews.title: Great for Elementary Music
customer_reviews.text: I am an elementary music teacher and I just bought a second one of these for my classroom. It's the perfect size for the students and it has a nice resonating crisp sound. I have an LP Cajon that I paid $200 for and the students like the sound and feel of this one much better. It's a great price and a great instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lane

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I've been going back and forth between Drums and Bongos and wanted Something new to throw into the Mix. First impression: Gorgeous! Had that New Car feel sitting on it for the first time (See video) Sounds great and feels natural with Tons of different Sounds to explore not to mention..Fun! Makes a very Comfortable Seat for Playing Bongos as well . The Compact size is impressive. Super easy Portability.
customer_reviews.author: patrick parton

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Drum
customer_reviews.text: I have recently gotten into hand drumming and fell in love with the sound of Cajon's and went looking for one I could learn on. Pros: Cost Sound Cons: Size is a bit small Other thoughts, watch a video on how to tune your cajon to your liking. I wanted more SNAP from my corners and was able to do it easily after watching a short video
customer_reviews.author: dreyco

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a cajon, but I believe it has good value. More fun and easier to play than my djembe. Seems well made and produces quality sounds. It is compact for travel, but it's not as loud as regular sized cajons. This is good for me since my kids like to play it and I often play at night. Not so good if you want to use it for live performances, but you can always mic it up.
customer_reviews.author: Shraider

customer_reviews.title: Sounds bigger than you think
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a small church gig while our main church is under repair. Room is about 500sf and even with it full of people, I can still get complaints that it's a bit too loud. The actual sound of the cajon is very very good. Both snare hits and kick hits are solid and full.
customer_reviews.author: T.Clark

customer_reviews.title: Looks like 2 shakers but molded together
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't familiar with this instrument and thought it was two separate shakers, but they're molded together. Not a problem, great soft sound, bought it for my baby and she's loving it! Light and easy for her to hold. Probably not water tight so just wipe it down if it gets dirty, rather than putting it under running water.
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynGirl

customer_reviews.title: It's a great shaker.
customer_reviews.text: A couple drummers at our church asked for a better shaker than what we had. I did some research and bought this. Every one of them loves it. The sound is great. It's easy to hold. It isn't heavy. It is so much better than a traditional egg shaker. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: TiMonte

customer_reviews.title: Great Cajon drum for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my second Cajon after realizing the first one I purchased was a larger and louder drum (no regrets, my neighbors just aren’t thrilled!), so thought adding this little guy to the mix would be fun for jam sessions and ease of moving around. I love the size and the finish, the craftsmanship is lovely, though unfortunately ours arrived with a defect on the wood. The sound is very distinct for its size, it has great bass and a nice snare for its size. It’s a ton of fun to play and extremely addicting even for newbies.
customer_reviews.author: Darryn K. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: A beginner, but the sounds out of this Cajon are amazing
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter for Christmas. It has a really great sound and is really easy to get several different sounds out of this one instrument. I had never heard of this instrument, but after watching a few different people on YouTube playing these, I was interested. Now looking forward to hearing what my daughter can do with this instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Highly Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Cajon we have purchased. We wanted something that could be used both by our grandkids to learn to play along with rhythm, but could also be used by adults. While it is probably an entry level item, it appears to be well built and has a decent sound. It is a smaller size (15 inches tall) but feels secure when an adult sits on it. It meets our needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Great shaker.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best shaker I’ve ever owned and I have had a lot of shakers!! The grip and balance give you a fine control of your sound. I might have to try the other colors. I got the black and it’s a nice sound that sits back in a mix, but adds a bit of energy.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge A. Valcarcel

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old Grandaugter is visually impaired and I was sure she'd love this after we showed her how to use it, as she likes all types of musical instruments. She didn't even finish unwrapping it and knew EXACTLY what is was and was SO EXCITED she had one of her very own and immediately set on it and went to town. Everybody at her Birthday party enjoyed watching her get so excited.
customer_reviews.author: SHERYL WELDON

customer_reviews.title: Good Item... not so good handling.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how to rate it. We like the product it was exactly what was expected. It was even delivered 1 day earlier than expected. Unfortunately, it came with a slight dent on the end of the item... I know eventually we would have probably put a dent or two on our own from normal use. I can't help but think that it was the way the package was handled as it was delivered. Looking at our home video cam, it appears that it was tossed on the ground instead or placed or set down.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Here’s the deal...
customer_reviews.text: Here’s the deal...This Meinl Cajon was everything I was looking for. The Cajon was nicely packaged upon receiving. I have a toddler that loves to play percussion instruments like I do. No scratches, every edge is super smooth and the sound is outstanding. If you’re thinking about buying a Cajon whether it’s your first one or not, BUY BUY BUY!!! What you waiting for!!
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Not much of a drummer but I like it
customer_reviews.text: This was sort of a whim, for me and my 10yr to use during quarantine, and it's great - it sounds good, it's easy to play, and it's also a handy stool - if only all our furniture could double as musical instruments!
customer_reviews.author: Toby B.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but Clean Sound
customer_reviews.text: The best thing I ever did with this shakes, was insert a maraca through the middle/center hole, and use that handle for shaking. Adding a maraca in this way provided a louder and just more dynamic and full sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong...
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Luis Conte Meinl shaker before and my previous model stopped sounding immediately when I stopped. This new version continues to make a sound - like a rain stick- which is not what you're looking for when making precise rhythms. I believe the error is in the inner material they chose.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bang bang bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great and its fun to play. I'm 220lbs and it holds my weight no problem. Very well made. Ive played on cheap cajons as well as expensive, and this one definitely falls into the latter category. Lots of bang for that buck! (Yes, I realize I'm a corny cheeseball...)
customer_reviews.author: Jaimz

customer_reviews.title: Not as smooth a sound at the black/medium sound shaker ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as smooth a sound at the black/medium sound shaker. It is indeed loud, but with out the nuanced sounds of the softer sounding shaker. I played it at a small outdoor concert and the sound was so loud it actually made my ear (closest to the shaker) ring! It will work for a big sound at outdoor events when you just want to project a loud percussion sound; but for indoor and recording, the black/medium shaker is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Does everything right!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cajon primarily to do some recordings with it. I've played it for the past week and I enjoy the sound of it a lot, crisp sound with the slaps and good depth on the low end. A bit of a small box, I tested a recording with a single condenser mic which produced a decent sound but I'm waiting to receive my dynamic to do a two mic setup. Overall beautiful sound and smooth play.
customer_reviews.author: Eron

customer_reviews.title: Good for jamming, not so great for recording
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for something to record with, I wouldn't get these. They have a cheap thin plastic sound (hard to explain). I use my eggs when recording them. However, these do work well in a rehearsal situation. Plenty loud enough to be heard while jamming. Haven't used them in a larger gig, but I would imagine mic'ing them to the PA would work, although at that point perhaps standard eggs would work just as well. For what they do, I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomerMN

customer_reviews.title: Adds to variety
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight which can be pro or con. Don’t know yet as far as durability. Seems more vulnerable than another brand I have. It is definitely loud, which I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Travlin' Annie

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for my kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my two sons - 12 and 8 years old. It was meant to keep them engaged... and to help them get interested in musical instruments. This box-drum is just their size... each of them can seat themselves comfortably on it and can play the instrument. Neither of them are experts, however, this drum is just what they need at this stage to understand rhythm... to experiment... and to practice. They listen to songs on YouTube and try to play the rhythm part of the music on their new box-drum. My wife and I are glad that we bought them this instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Crisp Sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Home Jam... has a crisp sound and for a price...it sure is worthy. I love the Snare and the quality of wood is superb. Thank you for making this without costing an arm and a leg.
customer_reviews.author: LV

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was needed!  Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas purchase for my 10 year old son, who is an aspiring percussionist. He'd been wanting one ever since he saw on at a concert. I was a bit apprehensive with the purchase since the price was SO LOW compared to the one he saw at the concert & compared to other more expensive options. I went ahead & ordered based on so many positive reviews both through Amazon & outside sources. So very glad we did. This box is very-well-made! If it can stand up to a 10 yr old's abuse & keep on ticking, we have a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ross

customer_reviews.title: fun as an apprentice.
customer_reviews.text: The cajon itself is definitely smaller than I expected (I know, they show measurements), but it has a surprisingly rich bass and nice, sharp snares. Being on the cheaper side, I expected the sound to suffer for it, but it really does sound quite good, especially for what it is. The only complaint I have is some edges of the wood could have been sanded down better, with a few jutting pieces, one that I actually cut my finger on along the back side. Easily self-fixable, but something to note. Overall a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: haesook  joo

customer_reviews.title: Ok for a beginner and little expensive.
customer_reviews.text: This is ok for a young beginner. The sound is not great, not a lot of variance. Fairly expensive for the quality. For the price a carrier case would be nice. My son is already ready for a better sounding one as he would like to continue to use this type of percussion.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Lee

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool, nice and portable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool Meinl but it's a lot smaller than I thought. My 6'1" teenager really likes it but it looks tiny under him. This is better suited for a smaller person. Sounds good, but not as robust as our neighbor's full size one. The advantage to the size is how portable it is. So if you're looking for one to travel with, this is ideal.
customer_reviews.author: The ATM Guy

customer_reviews.title: Solid first cajon!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cajon I have ever owned for myself. I used to worship in college campus Christian fellowship with a larger cajon that gave more of a deeper bass sound when played. This cajon still gives a nice bass sound, but it provides me with a crisper snare sound, which I enjoy. Definitely a good cajon to start out with, and it has served me well with worship in the virtual Christian fellowship setting (thanks to coronavirus) and at random campfire worship sessions! Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Mulderrig

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift...
customer_reviews.text: for my brother. It was a bit smaller than expected, but, supports a guy that is 205lbs with no issues. I've used it, as well, and it's nice. Sounds like a snare drum. Finish and color are nice, as well. Seems like it'll last a long time, and make some fun times, when being played.
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cajon for the value!
customer_reviews.text: Great Cajon for beginners. The sound quality is pretty good since the Cajon is not a “full size cajon”. Do note that this Cajon does sound a bit boxy without a microphone inside of the bass port. So if you are playing this without a PA system or a sub, the Cajon may sound a little bit boxy. The only con’s I have is that the snares are not adjustable without going inside the cajon and physically removing them.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome drum. You have to sit on it and play. My husband loves it! And it looks pretty too!
customer_reviews.author: Anu

customer_reviews.title: Great first cajon!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Cajon! Been wanting one for a while and been searching around. Saw some cheaper ones but this one seemed to have the best reviews. I really appreciate the quality and craftsmanship put into the woodwork, I also like the two-tone color and finish. The sound quality is excellent and I have been able to make many different sounds as I am a beginner. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: XAVER

customer_reviews.title: Big Sound, Little Box
customer_reviews.text: The cajon itself is definitely smaller than I expected (I know, they show measurements), but it has a surprisingly rich bass and nice, sharp snares. Being on the cheaper side, I expected the sound to suffer for it, but it really does sound quite good, especially for what it is. The only complaint I have is some edges of the wood could have been sanded down better, with a few jutting pieces, one that I actually cut my finger on along the back side. Easily self-fixable, but something to note. Overall a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Fisk Family

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Little Cajon
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, the sound could be a bit better since you can sometimes hear the snare without playing it, but it has solid construction and decent sound. Good for an entry level purchase if you don't want to spend that much.
customer_reviews.author: DavyJones

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great amplified shaker with a nice size fitting for you hand. It does exactly what a normal shaker would do, just more affordable. It’s made with a pretty sturdy plastic and has a nice noise to it. It’s very light and I love the logo that comes on the side. No complaints. I would suggest you sell it with a case or with a bag.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I would purchase this again!
customer_reviews.text: Though this instrument appears to be a toy due to it's plastic case, it is easy to hold and works great! The sound emitted is loud enough to be heard above other instruments and compliments them very well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cantu

customer_reviews.title: quality instrument
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2 year old son... I really research and try to keep toys to a minimum.... not interested in cheap china plastic CRAP.... teach them to enjoy quality young! He climbs on top and beams ear to ear and pounds the drum. ADORABLE!! HAPPY MOM. :)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel  & Estee Aijian

customer_reviews.title: It's a Hit!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product for my daughter who is into everything percussion. She is very happy with the Meinl Cajon Box Drum. The sound quality of the snare is very good. I was a little concerned about the size of the product, as my daughter is 5'9", but she is comfortable using it. I do notice she sometimes puts it on a stool or step when she sits on it so she is not as close to the ground. It is sturdy in it build, and I am overall very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: It was a lot smaller than I imagined, so I returned it. You can find bigger ones at actual music stores for similar prices, so it wasn't really worth it. Sound quality is decent, but again, it's better at actual music stores.
customer_reviews.author: Damaris N.

customer_reviews.title: great size. great balance. great sound.
customer_reviews.text: The black Luis Conte shaker is medium sound level. The grey one is loud and the red one is soft. I only have the black one and it is a nice sound.
customer_reviews.author: av8r567

customer_reviews.title: Great instrument addition
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to our group musical gatherings! Sounds great; well made! Reasonably priced and highly recommended! Wish we would have ordered it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M

customer_reviews.title: Quality, heavy duty, lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Multuple sounds from different sides. Quality craftsmanship. Lightweight. Has the snare drum strings inside. Perfect for a beginner like me, or somebody that knows what they are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Smooth sound.
customer_reviews.text: Smooth and consistent sound. For those who are looking at the various types of shakers (red, black, and gray), I use this shaker for acoustic unamplified settings and it produces plenty of volume. It's durable, cuz I drop it constantly. Fun fact: TSA always stops me just to look at it when I put it in my uke case. I always love to give it a shicka - shicka right in front of them for fun after they pull it out.
customer_reviews.author: hartmanrex

customer_reviews.title: Great for the budding percussionist!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sounding box drum for our budding percussionist! The tones are nice and the snare don't buzz and rattle like some inexpensive boxes. Put this on your list!
customer_reviews.author: J Prince

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Shaker for Live Gigs
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Artist Series Luis Conte Medium (Black) Shaker to use with an "amplified acoustic" act where I use a small cocktail drum kit. The Medium (Black) shaker was loud enough and sounded great. My band mates liked it very much and I really liked the versatility of the Artist Series Luis Conte Medium Shaker for different sound effects. I was even able to hold the shaker in combination with a stick on my hi-hat for a very cool shaker/hat effect.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shaker
customer_reviews.text: My favorite percussive shaker. Not rugged, be careful not to drop too many times. The thinness of plastic it is made with gives it the amazing sound it has.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great Cajon for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: This cajon does not have adjustable snares, but it does HAVE snares, which is rare for a cajon in this price range. It is well made, and once you find the sweet spots, it sounds really good. It is a little on the small side, which for my 11 year old son is perfect. Even being a little small, I can play it fine too though. I'm happy with my purchase and would buy it again. A great value!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Was pleasantly surprised by how good this sounds for the price. It's the compact size so a little smaller than normal but great for someone small like me. And it's super lightweight and easy to carry around for jam sessions. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lien

customer_reviews.title: Great starter Cajon
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like this cajon. It's my first cajon ever. I can see it's a great starter cajon for kids and adults. I'm learning how to play by watching youtube videos and then I teach my kids. I can tell it doesn't have as good of sound as the ones I watch in youtube videos in the lessons. But that being said, I think it's perfect for our needs (for me and my kids). It's good enough that I would play it in front of others at church, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hosfield

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: The sound is at a perfect level for acoustic jams. It's pretty durable, dropped it a couple of times and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Alisson Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Faster shipping than expected. Sound: Very impressive for a small boy, I was expecting lower sounds, holds it’s own properly against 2 jumbo acoustic guitars strumming uncontrollably. Build quality: Very impressed with over all sturdiness and wood quality of this cajon, I’ve played on a “high end” LP, and this small boy is right up there. Overall great instrument, if you’re considering it and want to get started, get this over anything else around this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Samir

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for a portable Cajon
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, although wanted a little more snare sound. Also should have gotten a little taller unit for my body size. Very worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great travel or beginner's cajon
customer_reviews.text: The cajon is an awesome instrument to pick up (or rather sit on) and play. This one is a smaller size for a smaller price but it's a quality build and finish. The tones on the side and top sound decent, the high tones sound great and the bass tone sounds pretty good for the size - just don't expect a ton of depth from the bass tone. Very happy with this purchase if you're on the fence.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Medium Size kids or Small Adult
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 12 year old and 8 year old to learn on. The sound quality is perfect. Sou is very Similar to the larger size one we use at our church for worship. Love the size for medium size kids. Love the sound. Love the portability. And bonus it is NOT too loud to play in any room of the house. The construction is well made also.
customer_reviews.author: Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound and just perfect for what we needed for our at home family worship! It even stands up to our five year old and twin three year olds playing..and they love it! Really helps get them excited and involved! Even better (I may be a biased mother) but this cajon sounds nice even when the kids play it. No more percussion drum banging, this actually sounds like beautiful music to my ears. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for acoustic jam sessions or recordings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because i wanted to start recording percussions for my Shelter in Place project. It’s ready to use, out of the box. Finish looks great. The snare is crisp and solid. The recording turned out great and the Cajon made the feel of the music very dynamic.
customer_reviews.author: RyCess

customer_reviews.title: Good sound.
customer_reviews.text: The cajon looks well made. It is sturdy and holds my weight easily (175 pounds). I have played it several times and it sounds good. Nice snare sound at the top and bass thump in the middle and lower.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Marching in Mardi Gras Krewe! Love em, bought two of them!
customer_reviews.text: I used these marching with my Mardi Gras Krewe. They are light, loud enough and sound great! And I can tie something between the two to hang from my waist when I am walking. Suits my needs and it's tough. Good quality plastic and doesn't seem like it would break easily. (I bought two, one set of two for each hand. They are connected)
customer_reviews.author: S. Atwe7

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great and is Easy to Learn
customer_reviews.text: Due to the shelter-in-place order, our Easter Sunday service was recorded on an iPhone and broadcast live on Facebook. We used this drum, along with a piano and guitar, in place of full band. The sound quality was excellent and our substitute and inexperienced drummer was able to play it within a few minutes of practice. We are extremely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Starduster

customer_reviews.title: Quality build, great sound.
customer_reviews.text: This compact (15" high) cajon packs great sound. This cajon has a nice bass note, and punchy snare response. It's a perfect beginner cajon. Being slightly smaller, this cajon is easy to transport, and would be a great choice for younger drummers. With the great sound, this drum will easily fit into small acoustic sets. Very pleased with this product, would definitely order from the Meinl company again.
customer_reviews.author: The Captain

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised how much I enjoyed playing it
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how much I enjoyed playing it. I had used egg shakers previously almost exclusively. I opened the package and was surprised at how light and loud it was. Its very not clunky and awkward, like other ones i had used in the past It's very simple to play if you have a good sense of rhythm.
customer_reviews.author: Yossi Berger

customer_reviews.title: Very clear and pleasant sound. Not too loud, but carries.
customer_reviews.text: Really love this shaker! The beads, or whatever inside must be very small. I find the sound they produce to be quite musical, sweet to my ear, not jarring. The other musicians have, when asked by me, described the sound as, "good projection," "very clear sound", and "crisp." I have very short fingers so I cannot wrap my hand from the bottom to top, and hold it midway, it the gap between the two sections. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Skid kid

customer_reviews.title: Good rhythm instrument
customer_reviews.text: I like the way you hold it. Very controllable, light weight so my Arm doesn’t get tired, good volume in the venue I play in(church). I used it last Sunday. I just like it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing products
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a gift for our son who plays drums!!! We use it on vacations to play musics! Excellent buy and great sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh. No regrets! I really like this for acoustic sets! Right amount of snap and bass!!!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for my teen drum enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: My teen son who plays drums loved receiving this for Christmas. It is smaller than I expected which isn’t bad because it doesn’t take up too much space, and it sounds great!
customer_reviews.author: Jreviews

customer_reviews.title: A bit "quieter" than medium, although smooth as silk
customer_reviews.text: I already had the "loud" one (stadium), so I needed something quieter. That said, this shaker is a bit "quieter" than what I would consider medium, and a big jump from the loud model. Although, it's as smooth as silk - great for recording, not so much live n an amped setting.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Meinl Cajon Box Drum with Internal Snares
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Meinl Cajon Box Drum with Internal Snares for a daughter-in-law who really wanted a musical instrument like a drum to simply enjoy creating rhythms with her hands. A musician friend has a Meinl cajon that he made from their kit. It sounded so neat! I purchased it for her as a Christmas gift. She loved it, and it is great to play! It is very well made and does everything they advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I love it as a beginner, it's very easy to use even tho the sound is not ready accurate but still very good choice for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: mery ak

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase of Meinl Cajon Box Drum
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert, but i was really impressed at the sound and build quality of the cajon. Based on specs, I was concerned that this particular one was a little smaller than others, but the volume is fine and sound/timbre possibilities are super cool. It's a good choice that will work with kids and adults. It was easy to rate this a 5 star. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Minervini

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is very well made. I'm impressed with the quality. It's made to allow for a good variety of sounds, base, treble, bongos, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cajon review by a music teacher
customer_reviews.text: Excellent snare and bass sounds, I would give e it five stars but it's a little small and because of this generates a little less sound in general if you're taller you'll definitely want a different Cajon. It's a great travel Cajon though!
customer_reviews.author: Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give these as a Christmas gift but while wrapping I found myself playing with them and getting down to the beat. Lol. I kept them for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tippertee

customer_reviews.title: Great starter cajon
customer_reviews.text: I sit on and play my cajon every single day - drives my dogs crazy - and Meinl is the leading brand in the cajon business.
customer_reviews.author: John J. DeSanto

customer_reviews.title: Shake your groove thing!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for live performance. My husband and I have an acoustic duo (Little Black Dress) and these shakers add just the right touch to our songs. I've tried other shakers and they are either too bulky, too tinny, or just "cheap" sounding. These really add a gentle, soft touch, without being overbearing. They are also very comfortable to hold. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for a simple bag
customer_reviews.text: Very simple design, but price is high as in this quality. Not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: good little cajon
customer_reviews.text: it does what it's supposed to, just wish there was a slightly better range of sounds
customer_reviews.author: ReviewsAreLike...

customer_reviews.title: Gray size for kids and teen
customer_reviews.text: Grandson is four a little tall for his age when sit on it his legs dangle but I think summer 2020 his foot will Touch the floor And it will be perfect lovely verry much
customer_reviews.author: linda agbabiaka

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our music room
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this and it has a really cool sound. I was hoping it would slightly louder but overall a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paula F V

customer_reviews.title: no padding!
customer_reviews.text: Construction is fine. The description clearly stated there was padding. Oh no there isn't!! None, nada. Disappointed. Had to sew my own as it was a gift and too late to return and purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: Ma hodge

customer_reviews.title: Fun and creative gift for my 5 year old daughter
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old daughter loves music and is always singing along with whatever song is on. Recently she has taken to banging the table, chair etc. for the beat of the song while singing which prompted me to get her the Cajon Box for Christmas. She absolutely loves it and the sound quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Z Family

customer_reviews.title: Very nice box drum
customer_reviews.text: Just as described. Purchased for my daughter for Christmas. She loves it. It has a nice sound
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Cleghorn

customer_reviews.title: It's all about the music
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my Hubby. He adores it, and we tend to travel with it going ot friends houses for random jam sessions. Took a little adjusting to find the right spot to hit and make it muscle memory to create the sound you wanted, but it's a pretty awesome little 'drum' set to have in an acoustic setting...
customer_reviews.author: charmed926

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value, perfect for young drummers!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful drum box. Excellent value, excellent sound! Great for young drummers!
customer_reviews.author: EFaithDO

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Got here right on time, no scratches no dents It’s my first canjon so exited to learn perfect size not too big.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our kids recently started a praise band at church. One of them is their percussionist. He noted that the full drum set is often times not appropriate for the music they're performing but they still need something. This Box drum has been just the thing. It's quality construction is impeccable with nicely mitered seams. It looks great too, the two tone look offered byt the birch front makes it very attractive. The size is perfect. It's large enough to offer great sound yet small enough to be easily portable. The sound is great, offering several different tones depending on how you play it. We are very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rud Dad

customer_reviews.title: Shake! Shake! Shake Senora, shake your body line -- shake it all the time.
customer_reviews.text: After I found that I coudn't sing and keep time with the shaker, I donated it to my local karaoke show. Someone always grabs onto it and keeps time far better than I ever could!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Stewart

product_meta.title: Meinl Cajon Box Drum with Internal Snares — MADE IN EUROPE — Baltic Birch Wood Compact Size, 2-YEAR WARRANTY, JC50LBNT
product_meta.description: Color:JC50LBNTThe Meinl Jam Cajon is perfect for playing on the go. Its compact design is lightweight and easy to carry to drum circles, unplugged gigs or wherever you want to enjoy playing. The size makes it ideal to grab and go for spontaneous jam sessions and has every feature of a standard size MEINL Cajon. Crafted in Europe from birch wood, the Jam Cajon has great low end punch when played near the center and dishes out high frequency "slaps" when striking the top corners. Two sets of internal fixed snare wires brush against the playing surface to deliver a crisp, sensitive snare effect. The finish lets the beautiful natural wood grain show through, and the birch construction produces a rich sound that goes with any style music.
feature_bullets: Create drum set grooves with bass and snare notes using your hands — the wood playing surface has two zones for bass and snare — play with your hands toward the center for deep bass or strike near the top corners with your fingers for crisp snare sounds

Perfect for acoustic shows and jam sessions — the birch jam cajon is the perfect grab-and-go percussion instrument for singers/songwriter circles, spontaneous jam sessions, accompanying guitarists and supporting acoustic bands in coffee house settings

Internal snares — dual sets of internal fixed snare wires are positioned against the inside of the playing surface to give you the same effect as a snare drum — these snare wires are held in place with a thin mesh strap that leaves the tone unaltered

Made in Europe (light brown finish) — constructed with 100% Baltic birch wood, a wood type commonly found in high end drum set construction for its superb natural acoustic qualities that give you plenty of definition with deep bass and cutting high tones

Compact size — measuring 10 1/4" wide x 15" tall x 10 1/4" deep, the jam cajon is compact for easy transport and straightforward use so that anyone can sit down and play this instrument, regardless of skill level or age

Rear port for microphone placement — when amplification is needed, the best spot to place a microphone is at the rear port of this Cajon – this circular cutout also enhances low end bass by letting air escape the instrument as you play it

Other items on this page — we, the manufacturer, have styled like-items on this page as a way of conveniently presenting products that are frequently bought together – we invite you to sort customer comments by product to help make your purchasing choice

Manufacturer disclaimer — typographical or grammatical errors found in the bullet point or description text on this product page are a result of this site’s system and are neither the fault of the manufacturer nor marketplace sellers
